Participants.evidence: Seventeen epilepsy patients participated in an ECoG motor mapping experiment at a single center. Eligibility included patients undergoing presurgical evaluation.

Intervention.evidence: Patients performed a 5-minute hand/tongue movement task while ECoG signals were recorded. All patients underwent ECS mapping, and eight also had fMRI.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to validate ECoG for presurgical mapping by comparing it with direct electrical cortical stimulation (ECS) and functional MRI (fMRI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: GLM-based ECoG mapping showed consistent motor region localization with ECS.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ECoG had higher sensitivity than fMRI (66.7% vs. 52.6%, p < 0.05) with high specificity for both (>97%).
